Books of 2012

January 16, 2013 Posted in: reading list

2012 was a breakout year for my love of books and reading. I inadvertently almost averaged a book a week and ended the year with 42. I guess that means this past year I discovered the meaning of life.

For posterity, here is the list:

I find it interesting to review what I gravitate towards after the fact to discover where my interests lie. Standout books for this year that I have added to my recommended reading list are as follows:

Favorite Books of 2012

The Ender’s Game series by Orson Scott Card.

I am a big fan of the science fiction variety. The world and characters Orson Scott Card created in the Enderverse will stay with me for a long time to come.

Rock, Paper, Scissors by Len Fisher

Happiest Baby on the Block by Harvey Karp

In a Pit with a Lion on a Snowy Day by Mark Batterson

The Starfish and the Spider by Ori Brafman and Rod Beckstrom

The Optimism Bias by Tali Sharot
